[![](https://img.shields.io/pypi/v/runcmd.svg?maxAge=3600)](https://pypi.org/project/runcmd/)[![](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-Unlicense-blue.svg?longCache=True)](https://unlicense.org/)### Installation```bash$ [sudo] pip install runcmd```#### Examples```python>>> import runcmd>>> r = runcmd.run(["echo", "hello world"])>>> r.code # exit status code0>>> r.out # stdout'hello world'>>> r.err # stderr''>>> r.pid # process pid1234````background=True````python>>> r = runcmd.run(["sleep","5"],background=True)>>> while r.running: # True if process is running and not "zombie process">>> print("running")````kill(signal=None)` - kill process```python>>> r.kill(-9)````exc()` - raise exception if code is not `0````python>>> runcmd.run(["ls"]).exc() # code 0, ok>>> runcmd.run(["mkdir", "/"]).exc() # code 1, raise OSError...OSError: exited with code 1mkdir: /: Is a directory```
